items.title: You’ve let yourself go and here’s how to get back into shape
items.summary:
It happens to the best of us. That moment when you realizse that you’ve let yourself go, and you need to get back on track. It may happen when you’re looking in the mirror or when you glance at yourself in a recent photo. Your first thought is to go on a ‘diet’ but as quickly as that enters your mind the ghosts of a hundred diets past return…along with all the frustration. Then you!

items.title: Steven Wilson will perform at Celebrity Theatre
items.summary:
Danny Zelisko Presents an evening with Steven Wilson and his North American Tour 2018 at 7:30pm on Monday, May 14, 2018  at the historic Celebrity Theatre. Reserved tickets go on sale Monday, October 2nd at www.celebritytheatre.com.  Steven Wilson released his critically acclaimed new album To the Bone this past August, with international music critics lauding the artist for continuing to expand his musical boundaries.   Wilson will return to North America for a Spring 2018 tour in support of the album. Wilson, described by Planet Rock as “one of the most prolific and unrivalled artists of our time,” will launch the!

items.title: Hearth ’61 rises to quickly become a must-try dining destination
items.summary:
If you mix one of Arizona’s most iconic resorts with one of the state’s most innovative chefs, you have a recipe for success. That recipe has made Hearth ’61, the signature restaurant at Mountain Shadows, a triumph of the tastebuds. The name Hearth ’61 refers to the centerpiece of the restaurant’s kitchen, which is a hearth. The hearth is responsible for some can’t miss deliciousness, including the Niman Ranch aged tomahawk ribeye for two ($120),!

The post Hearth ’61 rises to quickly become a must-try dining destination appeared first on AZ Big Media.

items.title: Mining in Arizona remains an economic goldmine
items.summary:
“What is not eaten is mined.” It’s a mining saying you may learn from Dave Kimball, a shareholder at Gallagher & Kennedy and an expert in mining in Arizona. Kimball’s expertise has been created through decades of natural resource lobbying, legislation and advocacy in mined land reclamation, mining and more. Who better to provide a quote that all Arizonans should not simply seek to understand, but to recognize as the literal foundation of Arizona’s economic!

The post Mining in Arizona remains an economic goldmine appeared first on AZ Big Media.

alternate.title: Mining in Arizona remains an economic goldmine

items.title: ULI report: Here are 5 ways states can create affordable housing
items.summary:
State governments, in partnership with cities and other local jurisdictions, can and should do more to promote housing development, affordable housing and choice through smarter local land use policies and incentives, according to a new Urban Land Institute (ULI) report, Yes in My Backyard. Rising housing costs are creating hardships for millions of U.S. households and taking a toll on economic growth – a problem made worse by local zoning and land use regulations and development!

The post ULI report: Here are 5 ways states can create affordable housing appeared first on AZ Big Media.

alternate.title: ULI report: Here are 5 ways states can create affordable housing

items.title: Valley Partnership event focuses on attracting and retaining major employers
items.summary:
The Valley’s leading economic development directors are working with state and regional leaders to bring additional high-quality jobs to the Valley to secure Arizona’s long-term employment base.  This month, Valley Partnership is bringing together the leading economic development directors of three major cities who will share what makes a great “catch” for their city and how these employers’ impact trickles down into other market sectors, including real estate.  These directors have helped to bring companies!

items.title: Plaza Companies, Holualoa Companies reinventing Park Central
items.summary:
It’s a change that has been decades in coming for one of central Phoenix’s most iconic properties. But the time for a new Park Central is now. Two of Arizona’s most prominent commercial real estate firms — Plaza Companies and Holualoa Companies — have teamed up to purchase a significant portion of the Park Central Mall site, once one of the Valley’s premier properties and one that has long been a target for redevelopment.  Plaza and Holualoa!

items.summary:

items.title: Here are 10 of the sweetest suites at Arizona resorts
items.summary:
It’s no secret that Arizona boasts some of the most luxurious resorts in the world – and, as a result, we are among the top destinations for large-scale business events, conferences and meetings on the globe. But, even wonder where the world’s top CEO’s rest their heads during said events? Which resorts boast the best suites in Arizona? We’ve got your answers here, as we asked some of Arizona’s top resorts about their most eye-popping!

items.title: ASU named most innovative school for the third year in a row
items.summary:
For the third year in a row, Arizona State University tops the list as the most innovative school in the nation, recognizing the university’s ground-breaking initiatives, partnerships, programs and research. U.S. News and World Report has named ASU as the most innovative school all three years it’s had the category. The widely touted set of annual rankings by the news magazine, which compares more than 1,500 institutions on a variety of metrics, was released today.!

The post ASU named most innovative school for the third year in a row appeared first on AZ Big Media.

items.title: Tupac? Bette Midler? High school pregame football music runs gamut
items.summary:
Football now comes with with a soundtrack. From high school to the NFL, athletes can be spotted before games with a popular piece of equipment. Headphones. In the Valley, the music high school players and coaches listen to ranges from hardcore rap by Tupac to easy listening by Bette Midler. “Football is definitely and mostly business, but music puts the emotion in it and gets you going and gets you hyped before the game,” Goodyear!

items.title: Urban Farm teaches you which fruit trees will work in your yard
items.summary:
The Urban Farm announced the dates to its open house for the 18th annual Urban Farm Fruit Tree Education Program in the Valley of the Sun. The two-day event takes place at The Urban Farm located at 6750 N 13th Place, in Phoenix, on November 3 and 4 from 8:30 to 11:30 a.m. Here you will see full-grown fruit trees and learn which ones will work for your yard. Two guided “tours” will run at 8:45!

items.title: Your Experience Counts targets shortage of classroom volunteers
items.summary:
“We have a shortage of at least 20 classroom volunteers to meet the needs of students and teachers in the Mesa Public Schools,” according to Mike Beardslee, Program Director for Your Experience Counts.  YEC provided 39 volunteers to support nine Mesa elementary schools last year, but “Principals have requested nearly 20 more for 2017-2018,” Beardslee stated. YEC, a program of HandsOn Greater Phoenix, is in its 12th year of training and placing volunteers in classrooms!

The post Your Experience Counts targets shortage of classroom volunteers appeared first on AZ Big Media.

items.title: Minder Binders memorabilia will be auctioned Sept. 30
items.summary:
Rare memorabilia from an iconic Tempe restaurant and popular ASU hangout will hit the auction block on Saturday, Sept. 30 as new owners prepare to introduce a new, rebranded restaurant in its place this fall. More than 500 kitschy, quirky and colossal pieces from Minder Binders’ walls, ceilings, doors, and other nooks and crannies have been removed from the historic landmark and will be auctioned at EJ’s Auction & Consignment, 5880 W. Bell Road, in!

items.title: University of Arizona donors continue $200M-plus trend
items.summary:
For the fourth year in a row, donors gave or pledged more than $200 million to the University of Arizona. With $264.7 million in gifts and commitments, fiscal 2017 was the second-highest fundraising year in University history. In fiscal 2015, the total was $293.5 million.  “Steadfast generosity continues to make the UA a better and more accessible university,” said John-Paul Roczniak, vice president of development and chief development officer for the UA and president and!

The post University of Arizona donors continue $200M-plus trend appeared first on AZ Big Media.

items.title: Scottsdale Museum of Contemporary Art is free on Sept. 23
items.summary:
Scottsdale Museum of Contemporary Art will be free to all guests on Saturday, Sept. 23, as part of Smithsonian magazine’s 13th annual Museum Day Live. During the annual event, participating museums across the United States embrace the spirit of the Smithsonian Institution’s Washington, D.C.-based facilities — which offer free admission every day — and open their doors for free to those who download a Museum Day Live! ticket.  Last year, more than 200,000 people downloaded!

The post Scottsdale Museum of Contemporary Art is free on Sept. 23 appeared first on AZ Big Media.

alternate.title: Scottsdale Museum of Contemporary Art is free on Sept. 23
